1.text: Hold the banana in your hand, stem pointing up.

2.text: Snap off the stem and peel the skin downward.

4.text: Hold the banana with the stem pointing downwards.

5.text: Pinch or push just at the tip to tear the skin.

7.text: Take a banana that isn't overly ripe.

8.text: Hold either side of the banana, placing it in a smiling shape.

10.text: Peel each banana half and enjoy.

12.text: Cut the banana from the tip to the handle.

13.text: Cut each half down the middle horizontally.

14.text: Peel the skin off the four pieces.

15.text: Hold the stem of the banana so that it curves toward you.

16.text: Snap the banana forward, like you're cracking a whip.

17.text: Peel the rest of the banana the normal way.

18.text: Make a tiny cut in the surface of the top of the stem.

19.text: Peel the banana stem back so the skin breaks where the cut was made and peel it down all the way.

20.text: Hold the banana in both hands.

21.text: Twist the banana carefully without squeezing it.

22.text: Peel the banana the rest of the way.

23.text: Hold the banana horizontally in one hand.

24.text: Cut off each side of the banana.

25.text: Slice the banana skin lengthwise and then peel off the entire skin.
